description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5dvu","text":"Step by step protocol for setting up live microscopy experiments with Ibidi perfusion sets","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5iqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer:

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3op0k","text":"Check whether HUVECs in T25/T75 are confluent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg9i3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mjfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0l5l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83vsn","text":"Bring trypsin, PBS, media and FBS to to 37C inside cell culture incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cqku","text":"Gelatinize 2 or 3 Ibidi 0.4 luer u-slides with 0.2% gelatin in water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qkc9","text":"Trypsinize dish and count cells. A minimum of 500k cells are needed for 2 slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"moj8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95fhg","text":"Seed slides with HUVECs at a density of 2.2 million/mL, with 100 uL volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cr5m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42v6c","text":"Add 120 uL of EGM2 media with antibiotics 20 to 30 minutes after seeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84hac","text":"In a 2 mL eppi, dilute 1:1000 sir-DNA(in -20C, there should be two tubes in 2 seperate boxes. One box has 2 tubed labeled as sirDNA but only one of them is the real one(not sure why). Just make sure to get a tube with a colored liquid in it) in CO2 independent medium(transparent, should be a falcon in 4C. If not, there is also a stock you can add Gentamicin to)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd3o9","text":"Aspirate medium from the slides and add 250 uL of previous mix into each slide. Incubate at 37C for 1 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g5si","text":"Aspirate medium from slides again and then add 250 uL CO2 independent media without sirDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"644do","text":"Bring one slide and a plastic clamp to the microscopy room. While clamped carefully connect the slide to the unit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmevh","text":"Prepare one set of ibidi flow unit by adding 14 mL of CO2 independent medium. Extend the male coupling with the tubes in the extra coupling box. You should have slightly elongates tubes in a tube\u003emale adaptor\u003efemale joiner\u003eextra tube\u003emale coupler\u003eluer female coupler order","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a95b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fr5t","text":"Put one pair of male luer couplers, 2 sets of syringes and 1 set of male extenders(for live microscopy, there are some on my bench. Basically 2 tubes inside a pipette tip box) inside the incubator for overnight degassing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e68tu","text":"Bring the perfusion pump, laptop, 2 medium sized pipette tip boxes and the  flow unit to the microscopy room(use the carts)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8js3","text":"Set up the flow unit inside the incubator while setting the pump and the incubator outside. The best way to do this is putting two pipette tip boxes on the bottom right part of the chamber and then setting up the flow unit on top of these boxes, making sure that the setup is stable. Continue with connecting the air tube and electric cable, there is a stage exit for such cables. Turn on microscope and incubator and open ZEN. Calibrate, pinch test and start running at 37C but without CO2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":479,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2siot","text":"Wipe both sides of the slide with isopropanol as well as the objective","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kl0v","text":"On ZEN, withdraw the imaging setup from an image in Anna/210709_Wt_flow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9lk1l","text":"Turn on Definite Focus. Click Find Surface/Focus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6edke","text":"Check focus on Live and make necessary manual focusing adjustments and click store focus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ertnt","text":"Check whether definite focus is on for focus strategy, enable definite focus for every tile scan","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v4fm","text":"Check that Tile scan is set to 3x3 and that a 250+ frame timed capture will be done, change autosave to stream","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2uht","text":"Start experiment. If possible, check whether everything is in focus after the first 10 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51q94","text":"After 24 hours, dismantle the flow unit. You can bring the unit with the it to the 4C room and I can take it apart and clean afterwards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Perfusion Live Microscopy Using Zeiss LSM 780 and Ibidi Perfusion Sets
title_html: Perfusion Live Microscopy Using Zeiss LSM 780 and Ibidi Perfusion Sets

versions.title: Perfusion Live Microscopy Using Zeiss LSM 780 and Ibidi Perfusion Sets with SPY650 DNA Dye
